keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

headline.print_headline: Young Migrants Reach Europe Alone and Afraid
headline.main: Migrant Children, Arriving Alone and Frightened

snippet: Many of Europe’s new mystery children are boys ages 14 to 17, sent by families too poor to pay smugglers for more than one journey. Others were separated from their parents along the way.
abstract: Tens of thousands of child and teenage migrants are arriving in Europe on their own, separated from their parents en route or forced to flee their home countries alone; most solo child migrants are boys aged 14 to 17, while only 2 percent are girls; growing tide has prompted European child welfare workers to devote increased time to finding foster families, shelters and psychological support for young migrants.
lead_paragraph: Many of Europe’s new mystery children are boys ages 14 to 17, sent by families too poor to pay smugglers for more than one journey. Others were separated from their parents along the way.
